publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: Una tortilla gorda se escapó de la casa donde la hicieron. No permitió que nadie se la comiera hasta que se encontró con una niña pobre.

sourceDesc.bibl: Staa nti'i Beckmann, Gisela; Nieves, María M.. 2007. (2nd ed.). Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

normalization.ab: 2018-02-05Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GU%C3%8DA%20ORTOGR%C3%81FICA%20PRELIMINAR%20Short%20version.xml

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: One day a woman was making a lot of tortillas.
Érase una vez una mujer hacía muchas tortillas.
One tortilla came out thick and big.
Una tortilla salió gueso y grande.
And then she wanted to name it: fat tortilla.
The fat tortilla did not allow itself to get eaten by the woman.
La tortilla gorda no se permitió a ser comido por la mujer.
did not allow the woman to eat him
didn't allow himself to be eaten by the woman
no se permitió a ser comido por la mujer
Then it jumped off the grill and it ran away.
Y se saltó del comal y salió corriendo.
it jumped down from the grill
And so that woman chased the tortilla and said:
Y entonces la mujer persiguió la tortilla y dijó:
Fat tortilla, wait, I want to eat you!
And then the tortilla laughed and ran away.
Y la tortilla rió y se fue.
There it went and then it met with a very rich man.
Se fue y se encontró un hombre muy rico.
And then that man who had not to eaten the tortilla and said:
Y el hombre que aún no ha comido tortillas dijó:
Fat tortilla, come back, I want to eat you!
And then the tortilla laughed and ran away.
Y la tortilla rió y se fue.
It came to a small town and passed by where a woman selling tacos and that woman said:
Y llegó a un pueblo pequeño y se aproximó a un lugar dondé había una mujer que vendía tacos, y la mujer dijó:
Fat tortilla, come back, I want to eat you!
And the tortilla laughed again and then went.
Y la tortilla rió y se fue.
It arrived in the woods and met with a hungry coyote.
Llegó en el bosque y encontró con un coyote que tenía hambre.
When he saw the tortilla's face he growled:
Cuando él vi la cara de la tortilla él gruñó:
Fat tortilla, come back, I want to eat you!
Then the tortilla laughed and then hid.
Y la tortilla rió y se escondió.
Then the tortilla was up in a tree and it saw a small girl coming with an empty basket.
Y la tortilla estaba en un arbol y vio una niña que acercaba con una canasta vacía.
The little girl was very hungry.
Then the fat tortilla said the following:
Y la tortilla gorda dijó así:
I want this little girl to eat me.
Quiero que esta pequeña niña me coma.
It ran over to the little girl and then jumped and entered the basket.
Corrió hacia la niña y saltó en la canasta.
